tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE WaterLevels (
  reservoir_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  reservoir_name VARCHAR(50),
  river_id INT,
  river_name VARCHAR(50),
  water_level INT,
  measurement_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE Reservoirs (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    capacity DECIMAL NOT NULL,
    current_level DECIMAL NOT NULL,
    last_update TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE Rivers (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    length DECIMAL NOT NULL,
    flow_rate DECIMAL NOT NULL,
    water_level DECIMAL NOT NULL,
    last_update TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE Reservoirs (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(255),
    capacity FLOAT,
    water_level FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE Rivers (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(255),
    length FLOAT,
    water_flow_rate FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE DroughtPredictions (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    region VARCHAR(255),
    prediction_date DATE,
    severity_level INT
)

CREATE TABLE MeasurementPoints (
  point_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  point_name VARCHAR(50),
  location VARCHAR(100),
  type VARCHAR(50),
  river_id INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (river_id) REFERENCES Rivers(river_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Measurements (
  measurement_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  measurement_date TIMESTAMP,
  water_level DECIMAL(10,2),
  point_id INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (point_id) REFERENCES MeasurementPoints(point_id)
);

CREATE TABLE DroughtPredictions (
  prediction_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  prediction_date TIMESTAMP,
  prediction_result VARCHAR(100),
  measurement_id INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (measurement_id) REFERENCES Measurements(measurement_id)
);
